name: 傅子恒
objective: This course provides the fundamental knowledge, the structure and the designing methods of interactive programming. Student will learn the capability of using interactive programming design, analysis and development to implement the graphic, visual, sound, and touching interaction in interactive technology.
schedule:
W01: Introduction to Interactive Programing
W02: Ch01. The Art of Programming Mechanics – part I
W03: Ch01. The Art of Programming Mechanics – part II
W04: Ch02. Real-world Mechanics – part I
W05: Ch02. Real-world Mechanics – part II
W06: Ch03. Animation Mechanics
W07: Ch04. Game Rules and Mechanics
W08: Ch04. Game Rules and Mechanics
W09: Mid-term
W10: Ch05. Character Mechanics
W11: Ch05. Character Mechanics
W12: Ch05. Character Mechanics
W13: Final Project Proposal
W14: Ch06. Player Mechanics
W15: Ch07. Environmental Mechanics
W16: Ch07. Environmental Mechanics
W17: Ch08. Mechanics for External Forces
W18: Final Project Demo
materials: De Byl, Penny - Holistic game development with Unity_ an all-in-one guide to implementing game mechanics, art, design, and programming.
remarks:
